translations.translation: Disables the need for the kernel to update file access time every time it's requested.
Secured profile: combines stability with an adequate level of efficiency. First, files are written and then all elements are wiped in order to ensure data stability.
Highly-secure profile: Your file transfers will be more stable at the expense of performance.
Unsecured profile: Very high-performance but dangerous option as the ZFS ignores synchronous transfer requests (BDD, NFS, etc.).
Administrators should use this option only if they clearly understand the risks.
The ZFS options will be modified shortly.
There was an error when modifying the ZFS options.
There was an error when loading the ZFS options.
